data UpdateEnrollmentStatus
UpdateEnrollmentStatus' :: Maybe Bool -> Status -> UpdateEnrollmentStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateEnrollmentStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeMemberAccounts:UpdateEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>updateEnrollmentStatus_includeMemberAccounts</a> - Indicates
--   whether to enroll member accounts of the organization if the account
--   is the management account of an organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>updateEnrollmentStatus_status</a> - The new enrollment status of
--   the account.
--   
--   The following status options are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - Opts in your account to the Compute Optimizer
--   service. Compute Optimizer begins analyzing the configuration and
--   utilization metrics of your Amazon Web Services resources after you
--   opt in. For more information, see <a>Metrics analyzed by Compute
--   Optimizer</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - Opts out your account from the Compute
--   Optimizer service. Your account's recommendations and related metrics
--   data will be deleted from Compute Optimizer after you opt out.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <tt>Pending</tt> and <tt>Failed</tt> options cannot be used to
--   update the enrollment status of an account. They are returned in the
--   response of a request to update the enrollment status of an account.
newUpdateEnrollmentStatus :: Status -> UpdateEnrollmentStatus

--   constructor.

--   constructor.
data ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations
ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe FileFormat -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter] -> Maybe [ExportableLambdaFunctionField] -> Maybe Bool -> S3DestinationConfig -> ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountIds:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_accountIds</a> - The IDs of the
--   Amazon Web Services accounts for which to export Lambda function
--   recommendations.
--   
--   If your account is the management account of an organization, use this
--   parameter to specify the member account for which you want to export
--   recommendations.
--   
--   This parameter cannot be specified together with the include member
--   accounts parameter. The parameters are mutually exclusive.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts are not included in the export if
--   this parameter, or the include member accounts parameter, is omitted.
--   
--   You can specify multiple account IDs per request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileFormat:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_fileFormat</a> - The format of
--   the export file.
--   
--   The only export file format currently supported is <tt>Csv</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_filters</a> - An array of
--   objects to specify a filter that exports a more specific set of Lambda
--   function recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldsToExport:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_fieldsToExport</a> - The
--   recommendations data to include in the export file. For more
--   information about the fields that can be exported, see <a>Exported
--   files</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeMemberAccounts:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_includeMemberAccounts</a> -
--   Indicates whether to include recommendations for resources in all
--   member accounts of the organization if your account is the management
--   account of an organization.
--   
--   The member accounts must also be opted in to Compute Optimizer, and
--   trusted access for Compute Optimizer must be enabled in the
--   organization account. For more information, see <a>Compute Optimizer
--   and Amazon Web Services Organizations trusted access</a> in the
--   <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts of the organization are not
--   included in the export file if this parameter is omitted.
--   
--   This parameter cannot be specified together with the account IDs
--   parameter. The parameters are mutually exclusive.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts are not included in the export if
--   this parameter, or the account IDs parameter, is omitted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3DestinationConfig:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendations_s3DestinationConfig</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations :: S3DestinationConfig -> ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendations

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse
ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Destination -> Int -> ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse_jobId</a> - The
--   identification number of the export job.
--   
--   Use the DescribeRecommendationExportJobs action, and specify the job
--   ID to view the status of an export job.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Destination:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse_s3Destination</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>exportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse :: Int -> ExportLambdaFunctionRecommendationsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportEC2InstanceRecommendations</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations
ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe FileFormat -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe [ExportableInstanceField] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe RecommendationPreferences -> S3DestinationConfig -> ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountIds:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_accountIds</a> - The IDs of the
--   Amazon Web Services accounts for which to export instance
--   recommendations.
--   
--   If your account is the management account of an organization, use this
--   parameter to specify the member account for which you want to export
--   recommendations.
--   
--   This parameter cannot be specified together with the include member
--   accounts parameter. The parameters are mutually exclusive.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts are not included in the export if
--   this parameter, or the include member accounts parameter, is omitted.
--   
--   You can specify multiple account IDs per request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileFormat:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_fileFormat</a> - The format of the
--   export file.
--   
--   The only export file format currently supported is <tt>Csv</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_filters</a> - An array of objects
--   to specify a filter that exports a more specific set of instance
--   recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldsToExport:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_fieldsToExport</a> - The
--   recommendations data to include in the export file. For more
--   information about the fields that can be exported, see <a>Exported
--   files</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeMemberAccounts:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_includeMemberAccounts</a> -
--   Indicates whether to include recommendations for resources in all
--   member accounts of the organization if your account is the management
--   account of an organization.
--   
--   The member accounts must also be opted in to Compute Optimizer, and
--   trusted access for Compute Optimizer must be enabled in the
--   organization account. For more information, see <a>Compute Optimizer
--   and Amazon Web Services Organizations trusted access</a> in the
--   <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts of the organization are not
--   included in the export file if this parameter is omitted.
--   
--   Recommendations for member accounts are not included in the export if
--   this parameter, or the account IDs parameter, is omitted.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationPreferences:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_recommendationPreferences</a> - An
--   object to specify the preferences for the Amazon EC2 instance
--   recommendations to export.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3DestinationConfig:ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>exportEC2InstanceRecommendations_s3DestinationConfig</a> - An
--   object to specify the destination Amazon Simple Storage Service
--   (Amazon S3) bucket name and key prefix for the export job.
--   
--   You must create the destination Amazon S3 bucket for your
--   recommendations export before you create the export job. Compute
--   Optimizer does not create the S3 bucket for you. After you create the
--   S3 bucket, ensure that it has the required permissions policy policy
--   to allow Compute Optimizer to write the export file to it. If you plan
--   to specify an object prefix when you create the export job, you must
--   include the object prefix in the that you add to the S3 bucket. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Policy for Compute
--   Optimizer</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
newExportEC2InstanceRecommendations :: S3DestinationConfig -> ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations

--   count of organization member accounts that are opted in to the
--   service, if your account is an organization management account.

--   account is a management account of an organization.

--   enrollment status of the account.
--

--   because member accounts of an organization require more time to be
--   enrolled in the service.

--   last updated.

--   constructor.
data GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations
GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe RecommendationPreferences -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountIds:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_accountIds</a> - The ID of the
--   Amazon Web Services account for which to return Auto Scaling group
--   recommendations.
--   
--   If your account is the management account of an organization, use this
--   parameter to specify the member account for which you want to return
--   Auto Scaling group recommendations.
--   
--   Only one account ID can be specified per request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_filters</a> - An array of
--   objects to specify a filter that returns a more specific list of Auto
--   Scaling group recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingGroupArns:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_autoScalingGroupArns</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling groups for which to
--   return recommendations.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationPreferences:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_recommendationPreferences</a> -
--   An object to specify the preferences for the Auto Scaling group
--   recommendations to return in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_nextToken</a> - The token to
--   advance to the next page of Auto Scaling group recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getAutoScalingGroupRecommendations_maxResults</a> - The maximum
--   number of Auto Scaling group recommendations to return with a single
--   request.
--   
--   To retrieve the remaining results, make another request with the
--   returned <tt>nextToken</tt> value.
newGetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations :: GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations

--   constructor.

--   response's http status code.

pattern InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode_NetworkBandwidthUnderprovisioned :: InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode
pattern InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode_NetworkPPSOverprovisioned :: InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode
pattern InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode_NetworkPPSUnderprovisioned :: InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode

pattern JobFilterName_JobStatus :: JobFilterName
pattern JobFilterName_ResourceType :: JobFilterName

newtype Status
Status' :: Text -> Status

pattern Status_Failed :: Status

-- | Describes the enrollment status of an organization's member accounts
--   in Compute Optimizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountEnrollmentStatus</a> smart constructor.
data AccountEnrollmentStatus
AccountEnrollmentStatus' :: Maybe Status -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> AccountEnrollmentStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountEnrollmentStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccountEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>accountEnrollmentStatus_status</a> - The account enrollment status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AccountEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>accountEnrollmentStatus_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:AccountEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>accountEnrollmentStatus_statusReason</a> - The reason for the
--   account enrollment status.
--   
--   For example, an account might show a status of <tt>Pending</tt>
--   because member accounts of an organization require more time to be
--   enrolled in the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:AccountEnrollmentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>accountEnrollmentStatus_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - The Unix epoch
--   timestamp, in seconds, of when the account enrollment status was last
--   updated.
newAccountEnrollmentStatus :: AccountEnrollmentStatus

-- | Describes the configuration of an Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingGroupConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingGroupConfiguration
AutoScalingGroupConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> AutoScalingGroupConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingGroupConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSize:AutoScalingGroupConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupConfiguration_maxSize</a> - The maximum size, or
--   maximum number of instances, for the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:AutoScalingGroupConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupConfiguration_instanceType</a> - The instance type
--   for the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredCapacity:AutoScalingGroupConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupConfiguration_desiredCapacity</a> - The desired
--   capacity, or number of instances, for the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minSize:AutoScalingGroupConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupConfiguration_minSize</a> - The minimum size, or
--   minimum number of instances, for the Auto Scaling group.
newAutoScalingGroupConfiguration :: AutoScalingGroupConfiguration

-- | Describes an Auto Scaling group recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingGroupRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutoScalingGroupRecommendation
AutoScalingGroupRecommendation' :: Maybe Finding -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AutoScalingGroupConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [UtilizationMetric] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption] -> Maybe Double -> AutoScalingGroupRecommendation

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingGroupRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:finding:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_finding</a> - The finding
--   classification of the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   Findings for Auto Scaling groups include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NotOptimized</tt></b> —An Auto Scaling group is considered
--   not optimized when Compute Optimizer identifies a recommendation that
--   can provide better performance for your workload.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Optimized</tt></b> —An Auto Scaling group is considered
--   optimized when Compute Optimizer determines that the group is
--   correctly provisioned to run your workload based on the chosen
--   instance type. For optimized resources, Compute Optimizer might
--   recommend a new generation instance type.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRefreshTimestamp:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_lastRefreshTimestamp</a> - The
--   timestamp of when the Auto Scaling group recommendation was last
--   refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentConfiguration:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_currentConfiguration</a> - An array
--   of objects that describe the current configuration of the Auto Scaling
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services account ID of the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingGroupName:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_autoScalingGroupName</a> - The name
--   of the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilizationMetrics:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_utilizationMetrics</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe the utilization metrics of the Auto Scaling
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingGroupArn:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_autoScalingGroupArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationOptions:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_recommendationOptions</a> - An array
--   of objects that describe the recommendation options for the Auto
--   Scaling group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookBackPeriodInDays:AutoScalingGroupRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendation_lookBackPeriodInDays</a> - The
--   number of days for which utilization metrics were analyzed for the
--   Auto Scaling group.
newAutoScalingGroupRecommendation :: AutoScalingGroupRecommendation

-- | Describes a recommendation option for an Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption
AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe [UtilizationMetric] -> Maybe AutoScalingGroupConfiguration -> Maybe Int -> AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:performanceRisk:AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendationOption_performanceRisk</a> - The
--   performance risk of the Auto Scaling group configuration
--   recommendation.
--   
--   Performance risk indicates the likelihood of the recommended instance
--   type not meeting the resource needs of your workload. Compute
--   Optimizer calculates an individual performance risk score for each
--   specification of the recommended instance, including CPU, memory, EBS
--   throughput, EBS IOPS, disk throughput, disk IOPS, network throughput,
--   and network PPS. The performance risk of the recommended instance is
--   calculated as the maximum performance risk score across the analyzed
--   resource specifications.
--   
--   The value ranges from <tt>0</tt> - <tt>4</tt>, with <tt>0</tt> meaning
--   that the recommended resource is predicted to always provide enough
--   hardware capability. The higher the performance risk is, the more
--   likely you should validate whether the recommendation will meet the
--   performance requirements of your workload before migrating your
--   resource.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedUtilizationMetrics:AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendationOption_projectedUtilizationMetrics</a>
--   - An array of objects that describe the projected utilization metrics
--   of the Auto Scaling group recommendation option.
--   
--   The <tt>Cpu</tt> and <tt>Memory</tt> metrics are the only projected
--   utilization metrics returned. Additionally, the <tt>Memory</tt> metric
--   is returned only for resources that have the unified CloudWatch agent
--   installed on them. For more information, see <a>Enabling Memory
--   Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendationOption_configuration</a> - An array
--   of objects that describe an Auto Scaling group configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rank:AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingGroupRecommendationOption_rank</a> - The rank of the
--   Auto Scaling group recommendation option.
--   
--   The top recommendation option is ranked as <tt>1</tt>.
newAutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption :: AutoScalingGroupRecommendationOption

-- | Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of Amazon Elastic
--   Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume recommendations. Use this filter with
--   the GetEBSVolumeRecommendations action.
--   
--   You can use <tt>LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter</tt> with the
--   GetLambdaFunctionRecommendations action, <tt>JobFilter</tt> with the
--   DescribeRecommendationExportJobs action, and <tt>Filter</tt> with the
--   GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations and GetEC2InstanceRecommendations
--   actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEBSFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EBSFilter
EBSFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe EBSFilterName -> EBSFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>EBSFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:EBSFilter'</a>, <a>eBSFilter_values</a> - The value of
--   the filter.
--   
--   The valid values are <tt>Optimized</tt>, or <tt>NotOptimized</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EBSFilter'</a>, <a>eBSFilter_name</a> - The name of the
--   filter.
--   
--   Specify <tt>Finding</tt> to return recommendations with a specific
--   finding classification (for example, <tt>NotOptimized</tt>).
newEBSFilter :: EBSFilter

-- | Describes a utilization metric of an Amazon Elastic Block Store
--   (Amazon EBS) volume.
--   
--   Compare the utilization metric data of your resource against its
--   projected utilization metric data to determine the performance
--   difference between your current resource and the recommended option.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEBSUtilizationMetric</a> smart constructor.
data EBSUtilizationMetric
EBSUtilizationMetric' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe EBSMetricName -> Maybe MetricStatistic -> EBSUtilizationMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>EBSUtilizationMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:EBSUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>eBSUtilizationMetric_value</a> - The value of the utilization
--   metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EBSUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>eBSUtilizationMetric_name</a> - The name of the utilization metric.
--   
--   The following utilization metrics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>VolumeReadOpsPerSecond</tt> - The completed read operations
--   per second from the volume in a specified period of time.Unit:
--   Count</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeWriteOpsPerSecond</tt> - The completed write operations
--   per second to the volume in a specified period of time.Unit:
--   Count</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeReadBytesPerSecond</tt> - The bytes read per second from
--   the volume in a specified period of time.Unit: Bytes</li>
--   <li><tt>VolumeWriteBytesPerSecond</tt> - The bytes written to the
--   volume in a specified period of time.Unit: Bytes</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:EBSUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>eBSUtilizationMetric_statistic</a> - The statistic of the
--   utilization metric.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer API, Command Line Interface (CLI), and SDKs
--   return utilization metrics using only the <tt>Maximum</tt> statistic,
--   which is the highest value observed during the specified period.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer console displays graphs for some utilization
--   metrics using the <tt>Average</tt> statistic, which is the value of
--   <tt>Sum</tt> / <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. For
--   more information, see <a>Viewing resource recommendations</a> in the
--   <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>. You can also get averaged
--   utilization metric data for your resources using Amazon CloudWatch.
--   For more information, see the <a>Amazon CloudWatch User Guide</a>.
newEBSUtilizationMetric :: EBSUtilizationMetric

-- | Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of account
--   enrollment statuses. Use this filter with the
--   GetEnrollmentStatusesForOrganization action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnrollmentFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EnrollmentFilter
EnrollmentFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe EnrollmentFilterName -> EnrollmentFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>EnrollmentFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:EnrollmentFilter'</a>, <a>enrollmentFilter_values</a> -
--   The value of the filter.
--   
--   The valid values are <tt>Active</tt>, <tt>Inactive</tt>,
--   <tt>Pending</tt>, and <tt>Failed</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EnrollmentFilter'</a>, <a>enrollmentFilter_name</a> - The
--   name of the filter.
--   
--   Specify <tt>Status</tt> to return accounts with a specific enrollment
--   status (for example, <tt>Active</tt>).
newEnrollmentFilter :: EnrollmentFilter

-- | Describes the destination of the recommendations export and metadata
--   files.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportDestination</a> smart constructor.
data ExportDestination
ExportDestination' :: Maybe S3Destination -> ExportDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:ExportDestination'</a>, <a>exportDestination_s3</a> - An
--   object that describes the destination Amazon Simple Storage Service
--   (Amazon S3) bucket name and object keys of a recommendations export
--   file, and its associated metadata file.
newExportDestination :: ExportDestination

-- | Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of
--   recommendations. Use this filter with the
--   GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations and GetEC2InstanceRecommendations
--   actions.
--   
--   You can use <tt>EBSFilter</tt> with the GetEBSVolumeRecommendations
--   action, <tt>LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter</tt> with the
--   GetLambdaFunctionRecommendations action, and <tt>JobFilter</tt> with
--   the DescribeRecommendationExportJobs action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe FilterName -> Filter

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_values</a> - The value of the
--   filter.
--   
--   The valid values for this parameter are as follows, depending on what
--   you specify for the <tt>name</tt> parameter and the resource type that
--   you wish to filter results for:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Optimized</tt> or <tt>NotOptimized</tt> if you specify
--   the <tt>name</tt> parameter as <tt>Finding</tt> and you want to filter
--   results for Auto Scaling groups.</li>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Underprovisioned</tt>, <tt>Overprovisioned</tt>, or
--   <tt>Optimized</tt> if you specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>Finding</tt> and you want to filter results for EC2
--   instances.</li>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Ec2Instance</tt> or <tt>AutoScalingGroup</tt> if you
--   specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>RecommendationSourceType</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify one of the following options if you specify the
--   <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>FindingReasonCodes</tt>:<ul><li><b><tt>CPUOverprovisioned</tt></b>
--   — The instance’s CPU configuration can be sized down while still
--   meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>CPUUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   CPU configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of your
--   workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better CPU performance.</li><li><b><tt>MemoryOverprovisioned</tt></b>
--   — The instance’s memory configuration can be sized down while still
--   meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s memory configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better memory
--   performance.</li><li><b><tt>EBSThroughputOverprovisioned</tt></b> —
--   The instance’s EBS throughput configuration can be sized down while
--   still meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>EBSThroughputUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s EBS throughput configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better EBS throughput
--   performance.</li><li><b><tt>EBSIOPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s EBS IOPS configuration can be sized down while still
--   meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>EBSIOPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s EBS IOPS configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better EBS IOPS
--   performance.</li><li><b><tt>NetworkBandwidthOverprovisioned</tt></b> —
--   The instance’s network bandwidth configuration can be sized down while
--   still meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>NetworkBandwidthUnderprovisioned</tt></b> —
--   The instance’s network bandwidth configuration doesn't meet the
--   performance requirements of your workload and there is an alternative
--   instance type that provides better network bandwidth performance. This
--   finding reason happens when the <tt>NetworkIn</tt> or
--   <tt>NetworkOut</tt> performance of an instance is
--   impacted.</li><li><b><tt>NetworkPPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s network PPS (packets per second) configuration can be sized
--   down while still meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>NetworkPPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s network PPS (packets per second) configuration doesn't meet
--   the performance requirements of your workload and there is an
--   alternative instance type that provides better network PPS
--   performance.</li><li><b><tt>DiskIOPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s disk IOPS configuration can be sized down while still
--   meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>DiskIOPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s disk IOPS configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better disk IOPS
--   performance.</li><li><b><tt>DiskThroughputOverprovisioned</tt></b> —
--   The instance’s disk throughput configuration can be sized down while
--   still meeting the performance requirements of your
--   workload.</li><li><b><tt>DiskThroughputUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The
--   instance’s disk throughput configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better disk throughput performance.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_name</a> - The name of the filter.
--   
--   Specify <tt>Finding</tt> to return recommendations with a specific
--   finding classification (for example, <tt>Underprovisioned</tt>).
--   
--   Specify <tt>RecommendationSourceType</tt> to return recommendations of
--   a specific resource type (for example, <tt>Ec2Instance</tt>).
--   
--   Specify <tt>FindingReasonCodes</tt> to return recommendations with a
--   specific finding reason code (for example,
--   <tt>CPUUnderprovisioned</tt>).
newFilter :: Filter

-- | Describes an error experienced when getting recommendations.
--   
--   For example, an error is returned if you request recommendations for
--   an unsupported Auto Scaling group, or if you request recommendations
--   for an instance of an unsupported instance family.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRecommendationError</a> smart constructor.
data GetRecommendationError
GetRecommendationError' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GetRecommendationError

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRecommendationError</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:GetRecommendationError'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendationError_identifier</a> - The ID of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:GetRecommendationError'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendationError_code</a> - The error code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:GetRecommendationError'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendationError_message</a> - The message, or reason, for
--   the error.
newGetRecommendationError :: GetRecommendationError

-- | Describes an Amazon EC2 instance recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceRecommendation
InstanceRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Finding -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceRecommendationFindingReasonCode] -> Maybe [RecommendationSource] -> Maybe [UtilizationMetric] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceRecommendationOption] -> Maybe Double -> InstanceRecommendation

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceRecommendation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceArn:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_instanceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:finding:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_finding</a> - The finding classification of
--   the instance.
--   
--   Findings for instances include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Underprovisioned</tt></b> —An instance is considered
--   under-provisioned when at least one specification of your instance,
--   such as CPU, memory, or network, does not meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload. Under-provisioned instances may lead to
--   poor application performance.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Overprovisioned</tt></b> —An instance is considered
--   over-provisioned when at least one specification of your instance,
--   such as CPU, memory, or network, can be sized down while still meeting
--   the performance requirements of your workload, and no specification is
--   under-provisioned. Over-provisioned instances may lead to unnecessary
--   infrastructure cost.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Optimized</tt></b> —An instance is considered optimized
--   when all specifications of your instance, such as CPU, memory, and
--   network, meet the performance requirements of your workload and is not
--   over provisioned. For optimized resources, Compute Optimizer might
--   recommend a new generation instance type.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentInstanceType:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_currentInstanceType</a> - The instance type
--   of the current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRefreshTimestamp:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_lastRefreshTimestamp</a> - The timestamp of
--   when the instance recommendation was last refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingReasonCodes:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_findingReasonCodes</a> - The reason for the
--   finding classification of the instance.
--   
--   Finding reason codes for instances include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s CPU
--   configuration can be sized down while still meeting the performance
--   requirements of your workload. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>CPUUtilization</tt> metric of the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s CPU
--   configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of your
--   workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better CPU performance. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>CPUUtilization</tt> metric of the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>MemoryOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s memory
--   configuration can be sized down while still meeting the performance
--   requirements of your workload. This is identified by analyzing the
--   memory utilization metric of the current instance during the look-back
--   period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s memory
--   configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of your
--   workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better memory performance. This is identified by analyzing the memory
--   utilization metric of the current instance during the look-back
--   period.Memory utilization is analyzed only for resources that have the
--   unified CloudWatch agent installed on them. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling memory utilization with the Amazon CloudWatch Agent</a> in
--   the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>. On Linux instances, Compute
--   Optimizer analyses the <tt>mem_used_percent</tt> metric in the
--   <tt>CWAgent</tt> namespace, or the legacy <tt>MemoryUtilization</tt>
--   metric in the <tt>System/Linux</tt> namespace. On Windows instances,
--   Compute Optimizer analyses the <tt>Memory % Committed Bytes In
--   Use</tt> metric in the <tt>CWAgent</tt> namespace.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>EBSThroughputOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s EBS
--   throughput configuration can be sized down while still meeting the
--   performance requirements of your workload. This is identified by
--   analyzing the <tt>VolumeReadOps</tt> and <tt>VolumeWriteOps</tt>
--   metrics of EBS volumes attached to the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>EBSThroughputUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s EBS
--   throughput configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of
--   your workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better EBS throughput performance. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>VolumeReadOps</tt> and <tt>VolumeWriteOps</tt> metrics of EBS
--   volumes attached to the current instance during the look-back
--   period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>EBSIOPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s EBS IOPS
--   configuration can be sized down while still meeting the performance
--   requirements of your workload. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>VolumeReadBytes</tt> and <tt>VolumeWriteBytes</tt> metric of EBS
--   volumes attached to the current instance during the look-back
--   period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>EBSIOPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s EBS IOPS
--   configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of your
--   workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better EBS IOPS performance. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>VolumeReadBytes</tt> and <tt>VolumeWriteBytes</tt> metric of EBS
--   volumes attached to the current instance during the look-back
--   period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkBandwidthOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   network bandwidth configuration can be sized down while still meeting
--   the performance requirements of your workload. This is identified by
--   analyzing the <tt>NetworkIn</tt> and <tt>NetworkOut</tt> metrics of
--   the current instance during the look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkBandwidthUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   network bandwidth configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better network bandwidth performance. This is
--   identified by analyzing the <tt>NetworkIn</tt> and <tt>NetworkOut</tt>
--   metrics of the current instance during the look-back period. This
--   finding reason happens when the <tt>NetworkIn</tt> or
--   <tt>NetworkOut</tt> performance of an instance is impacted.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkPPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s network
--   PPS (packets per second) configuration can be sized down while still
--   meeting the performance requirements of your workload. This is
--   identified by analyzing the <tt>NetworkPacketsIn</tt> and
--   <tt>NetworkPacketsIn</tt> metrics of the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkPPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   network PPS (packets per second) configuration doesn't meet the
--   performance requirements of your workload and there is an alternative
--   instance type that provides better network PPS performance. This is
--   identified by analyzing the <tt>NetworkPacketsIn</tt> and
--   <tt>NetworkPacketsIn</tt> metrics of the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskIOPSOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s disk IOPS
--   configuration can be sized down while still meeting the performance
--   requirements of your workload. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>DiskReadOps</tt> and <tt>DiskWriteOps</tt> metrics of the current
--   instance during the look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskIOPSUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s disk
--   IOPS configuration doesn't meet the performance requirements of your
--   workload and there is an alternative instance type that provides
--   better disk IOPS performance. This is identified by analyzing the
--   <tt>DiskReadOps</tt> and <tt>DiskWriteOps</tt> metrics of the current
--   instance during the look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskThroughputOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   disk throughput configuration can be sized down while still meeting
--   the performance requirements of your workload. This is identified by
--   analyzing the <tt>DiskReadBytes</tt> and <tt>DiskWriteBytes</tt>
--   metrics of the current instance during the look-back period.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskThroughputUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The instance’s
--   disk throughput configuration doesn't meet the performance
--   requirements of your workload and there is an alternative instance
--   type that provides better disk throughput performance. This is
--   identified by analyzing the <tt>DiskReadBytes</tt> and
--   <tt>DiskWriteBytes</tt> metrics of the current instance during the
--   look-back period.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about instance metrics, see <a>List the available
--   CloudWatch metrics for your instances</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic
--   Compute Cloud User Guide</i>. For more information about EBS volume
--   metrics, see <a>Amazon CloudWatch metrics for Amazon EBS</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationSources:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_recommendationSources</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe the source resource of the recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilizationMetrics:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_utilizationMetrics</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the utilization metrics of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceName:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_instanceName</a> - The name of the current
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationOptions:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_recommendationOptions</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe the recommendation options for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookBackPeriodInDays:InstanceRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendation_lookBackPeriodInDays</a> - The number of
--   days for which utilization metrics were analyzed for the instance.
newInstanceRecommendation :: InstanceRecommendation

-- | Describes a recommendation option for an Amazon EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceRecommendationOption</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceRecommendationOption
InstanceRecommendationOption' :: Maybe [PlatformDifference] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe [UtilizationMetric] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> InstanceRecommendationOption

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceRecommendationOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:platformDifferences:InstanceRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendationOption_platformDifferences</a> - Describes
--   the configuration differences between the current instance and the
--   recommended instance type. You should consider the configuration
--   differences before migrating your workloads from the current instance
--   to the recommended instance type. The <a>Change the instance type
--   guide for Linux</a> and <a>Change the instance type guide for
--   Windows</a> provide general guidance for getting started with an
--   instance migration.
--   
--   Platform differences include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Hypervisor</tt></b> — The hypervisor of the recommended
--   instance type is different than that of the current instance. For
--   example, the recommended instance type uses a Nitro hypervisor and the
--   current instance uses a Xen hypervisor. The differences that you
--   should consider between these hypervisors are covered in the <a>Nitro
--   Hypervisor</a> section of the Amazon EC2 frequently asked questions.
--   For more information, see <a>Instances built on the Nitro System</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux</i>, or <a>Instances built
--   on the Nitro System</a> in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for
--   Windows</i>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkInterface</tt></b> — The network interface of the
--   recommended instance type is different than that of the current
--   instance. For example, the recommended instance type supports enhanced
--   networking and the current instance might not. To enable enhanced
--   networking for the recommended instance type, you must install the
--   Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) driver or the Intel 82599 Virtual
--   Function driver. For more information, see <a>Networking and storage
--   features</a> and <a>Enhanced networking on Linux</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   EC2 User Guide for Linux</i>, or <a>Networking and storage
--   features</a> and <a>Enhanced networking on Windows</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Windows</i>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StorageInterface</tt></b> — The storage interface of the
--   recommended instance type is different than that of the current
--   instance. For example, the recommended instance type uses an NVMe
--   storage interface and the current instance does not. To access NVMe
--   volumes for the recommended instance type, you will need to install or
--   upgrade the NVMe driver. For more information, see <a>Networking and
--   storage features</a> and <a>Amazon EBS and NVMe on Linux instances</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux</i>, or <a>Networking and
--   storage features</a> and <a>Amazon EBS and NVMe on Windows
--   instances</a> in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Windows</i>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceStoreAvailability</tt></b> — The recommended
--   instance type does not support instance store volumes and the current
--   instance does. Before migrating, you might need to back up the data on
--   your instance store volumes if you want to preserve them. For more
--   information, see <a>How do I back up an instance store volume on my
--   Amazon EC2 instance to Amazon EBS?</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   Premium Support Knowledge Base</i>. For more information, see
--   <a>Networking and storage features</a> and <a>Amazon EC2 instance
--   store</a> in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux</i>, or see
--   <a>Networking and storage features</a> and <a>Amazon EC2 instance
--   store</a> in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Windows</i>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>VirtualizationType</tt></b> — The recommended instance type
--   uses the hardware virtual machine (HVM) virtualization type and the
--   current instance uses the paravirtual (PV) virtualization type. For
--   more information about the differences between these virtualization
--   types, see <a>Linux AMI virtualization types</a> in the <i>Amazon EC2
--   User Guide for Linux</i>, or <a>Windows AMI virtualization types</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon EC2 User Guide for Windows</i>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Architecture</tt></b> — The CPU architecture between the
--   recommended instance type and the current instance is different. For
--   example, the recommended instance type might use an Arm CPU
--   architecture and the current instance type might use a different one,
--   such as x86. Before migrating, you should consider recompiling the
--   software on your instance for the new architecture. Alternatively, you
--   might switch to an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that supports the new
--   architecture. For more information about the CPU architecture for each
--   instance type, see <a>Amazon EC2 Instance Types</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:performanceRisk:InstanceRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendationOption_performanceRisk</a> - The performance
--   risk of the instance recommendation option.
--   
--   Performance risk indicates the likelihood of the recommended instance
--   type not meeting the resource needs of your workload. Compute
--   Optimizer calculates an individual performance risk score for each
--   specification of the recommended instance, including CPU, memory, EBS
--   throughput, EBS IOPS, disk throughput, disk IOPS, network throughput,
--   and network PPS. The performance risk of the recommended instance is
--   calculated as the maximum performance risk score across the analyzed
--   resource specifications.
--   
--   The value ranges from <tt>0</tt> - <tt>4</tt>, with <tt>0</tt> meaning
--   that the recommended resource is predicted to always provide enough
--   hardware capability. The higher the performance risk is, the more
--   likely you should validate whether the recommendation will meet the
--   performance requirements of your workload before migrating your
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedUtilizationMetrics:InstanceRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendationOption_projectedUtilizationMetrics</a> - An
--   array of objects that describe the projected utilization metrics of
--   the instance recommendation option.
--   
--   The <tt>Cpu</tt> and <tt>Memory</tt> metrics are the only projected
--   utilization metrics returned. Additionally, the <tt>Memory</tt> metric
--   is returned only for resources that have the unified CloudWatch agent
--   installed on them. For more information, see <a>Enabling Memory
--   Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:InstanceRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendationOption_instanceType</a> - The instance type
--   of the instance recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rank:InstanceRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>instanceRecommendationOption_rank</a> - The rank of the instance
--   recommendation option.
--   
--   The top recommendation option is ranked as <tt>1</tt>.
newInstanceRecommendationOption :: InstanceRecommendationOption

-- | Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of recommendation
--   export jobs. Use this filter with the DescribeRecommendationExportJobs
--   action.
--   
--   You can use <tt>EBSFilter</tt> with the GetEBSVolumeRecommendations
--   action, <tt>LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter</tt> with the
--   GetLambdaFunctionRecommendations action, and <tt>Filter</tt> with the
--   GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations and GetEC2InstanceRecommendations
--   actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobFilter</a> smart constructor.
data JobFilter
JobFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe JobFilterName -> JobFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>JobFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:JobFilter'</a>, <a>jobFilter_values</a> - The value of
--   the filter.
--   
--   The valid values for this parameter are as follows, depending on what
--   you specify for the <tt>name</tt> parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Ec2Instance</tt> or <tt>AutoScalingGroup</tt> if you
--   specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as <tt>ResourceType</tt>. There is
--   no filter for EBS volumes because volume recommendations cannot be
--   exported at this time.</li>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Queued</tt>, <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Complete</tt>,
--   or <tt>Failed</tt> if you specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>JobStatus</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:JobFilter'</a>, <a>jobFilter_name</a> - The name of the
--   filter.
--   
--   Specify <tt>ResourceType</tt> to return export jobs of a specific
--   resource type (for example, <tt>Ec2Instance</tt>).
--   
--   Specify <tt>JobStatus</tt> to return export jobs with a specific
--   status (e.g, <tt>Complete</tt>).
newJobFilter :: JobFilter

-- | Describes a projected utilization metric of an Lambda function
--   recommendation option.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric
LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe LambdaFunctionMemoryMetricName -> Maybe LambdaFunctionMemoryMetricStatistic -> LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric_value</a> - The values of the
--   projected utilization metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric_name</a> - The name of the
--   projected utilization metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric_statistic</a> - The statistic
--   of the projected utilization metric.
newLambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric :: LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric

-- | Describes a recommendation option for an Lambda function.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption
LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionMemoryProjectedMetric] -> Maybe Int -> LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:memorySize:LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption_memorySize</a> - The
--   memory size, in MB, of the function recommendation option.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedUtilizationMetrics:LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption_projectedUtilizationMetrics</a>
--   - An array of objects that describe the projected utilization metrics
--   of the function recommendation option.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rank:LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption_rank</a> - The rank of the
--   function recommendation option.
--   
--   The top recommendation option is ranked as <tt>1</tt>.
newLambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption :: LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption

-- | Describes an Lambda function recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data LambdaFunctionRecommendation
LambdaFunctionRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LambdaFunctionRecommendationFinding -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionRecommendationFindingReasonCode] -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric] -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionMemoryRecommendationOption] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> LambdaFunctionRecommendation

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:functionArn:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_functionArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the current function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:finding:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_finding</a> - The finding
--   classification of the function.
--   
--   Findings for functions include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Optimized</tt></b> — The function is correctly provisioned
--   to run your workload based on its current configuration and its
--   utilization history. This finding classification does not include
--   finding reason codes.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NotOptimized</tt></b> — The function is performing at a
--   higher level (over-provisioned) or at a lower level
--   (under-provisioned) than required for your workload because its
--   current configuration is not optimal. Over-provisioned resources might
--   lead to unnecessary infrastructure cost, and under-provisioned
--   resources might lead to poor application performance. This finding
--   classification can include the <tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt> and
--   <tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt> finding reason codes.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Unavailable</tt></b> — Compute Optimizer was unable to
--   generate a recommendation for the function. This could be because the
--   function has not accumulated sufficient metric data, or the function
--   does not qualify for a recommendation. This finding classification can
--   include the <tt>InsufficientData</tt> and <tt>Inconclusive</tt>
--   finding reason codes.Functions with a finding of unavailable are not
--   returned unless you specify the <tt>filter</tt> parameter with a value
--   of <tt>Unavailable</tt> in your
--   <tt>GetLambdaFunctionRecommendations</tt> request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentMemorySize:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_currentMemorySize</a> - The amount of
--   memory, in MB, that's allocated to the current function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRefreshTimestamp:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_lastRefreshTimestamp</a> - The
--   timestamp of when the function recommendation was last refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web
--   Services account ID of the function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingReasonCodes:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_findingReasonCodes</a> - The reason
--   for the finding classification of the function.
--   
--   Functions that have a finding classification of <tt>Optimized</tt>
--   don't have a finding reason code.
--   
--   Finding reason codes for functions include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>MemoryOverprovisioned</tt></b> — The function is
--   over-provisioned when its memory configuration can be sized down while
--   still meeting the performance requirements of your workload. An
--   over-provisioned function might lead to unnecessary infrastructure
--   cost. This finding reason code is part of the <tt>NotOptimized</tt>
--   finding classification.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt></b> — The function is
--   under-provisioned when its memory configuration doesn't meet the
--   performance requirements of the workload. An under-provisioned
--   function might lead to poor application performance. This finding
--   reason code is part of the <tt>NotOptimized</tt> finding
--   classification.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InsufficientData</tt></b> — The function does not have
--   sufficient metric data for Compute Optimizer to generate a
--   recommendation. For more information, see the <a>Supported resources
--   and requirements</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>. This
--   finding reason code is part of the <tt>Unavailable</tt> finding
--   classification.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Inconclusive</tt></b> — The function does not qualify for a
--   recommendation because Compute Optimizer cannot generate a
--   recommendation with a high degree of confidence. This finding reason
--   code is part of the <tt>Unavailable</tt> finding classification.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilizationMetrics:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_utilizationMetrics</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe the utilization metrics of the function.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:memorySizeRecommendationOptions:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_memorySizeRecommendationOptions</a> -
--   An array of objects that describe the memory configuration
--   recommendation options for the function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:functionVersion:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_functionVersion</a> - The version
--   number of the current function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfInvocations:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_numberOfInvocations</a> - The number
--   of times your function code was applied during the look-back period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:LambdaFunctionRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays</a> - The number
--   of days for which utilization metrics were analyzed for the function.
newLambdaFunctionRecommendation :: LambdaFunctionRecommendation

-- | Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of Lambda
--   function recommendations. Use this filter with the
--   GetLambdaFunctionRecommendations action.
--   
--   You can use <tt>EBSFilter</tt> with the GetEBSVolumeRecommendations
--   action, <tt>JobFilter</tt> with the DescribeRecommendationExportJobs
--   action, and <tt>Filter</tt> with the
--   GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations and GetEC2InstanceRecommendations
--   actions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter
LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilterName -> LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter_values</a> - The value of the
--   filter.
--   
--   The valid values for this parameter are as follows, depending on what
--   you specify for the <tt>name</tt> parameter:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify <tt>Optimized</tt>, <tt>NotOptimized</tt>, or
--   <tt>Unavailable</tt> if you specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>Finding</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specify <tt>MemoryOverprovisioned</tt>,
--   <tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt>, <tt>InsufficientData</tt>, or
--   <tt>Inconclusive</tt> if you specify the <tt>name</tt> parameter as
--   <tt>FindingReasonCode</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter_name</a> - The name of the
--   filter.
--   
--   Specify <tt>Finding</tt> to return recommendations with a specific
--   finding classification (for example, <tt>NotOptimized</tt>).
--   
--   Specify <tt>FindingReasonCode</tt> to return recommendations with a
--   specific finding reason code (for example,
--   <tt>MemoryUnderprovisioned</tt>).
newLambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter :: LambdaFunctionRecommendationFilter

-- | Describes a utilization metric of an Lambda function.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric
LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe LambdaFunctionMetricName -> Maybe LambdaFunctionMetricStatistic -> LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric_value</a> - The value of the
--   utilization metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric_name</a> - The name of the
--   utilization metric.
--   
--   The following utilization metrics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Duration</tt> - The amount of time that your function code
--   spends processing an event.</li>
--   <li><tt>Memory</tt> - The amount of memory used per invocation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric_statistic</a> - The statistic of
--   the utilization metric.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer API, Command Line Interface (CLI), and SDKs
--   return utilization metrics using only the <tt>Maximum</tt> statistic,
--   which is the highest value observed during the specified period.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer console displays graphs for some utilization
--   metrics using the <tt>Average</tt> statistic, which is the value of
--   <tt>Sum</tt> / <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. For
--   more information, see <a>Viewing resource recommendations</a> in the
--   <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>. You can also get averaged
--   utilization metric data for your resources using Amazon CloudWatch.
--   For more information, see the <a>Amazon CloudWatch User Guide</a>.
newLambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric :: LambdaFunctionUtilizationMetric

-- | Describes a projected utilization metric of a recommendation option,
--   such as an Amazon EC2 instance. This represents the projected
--   utilization of a recommendation option had you used that resource
--   during the analyzed period.
--   
--   Compare the utilization metric data of your resource against its
--   projected utilization metric data to determine the performance
--   difference between your current resource and the recommended option.
--   
--   The <tt>Cpu</tt> and <tt>Memory</tt> metrics are the only projected
--   utilization metrics returned when you run the
--   GetEC2RecommendationProjectedMetrics action. Additionally, the
--   <tt>Memory</tt> metric is returned only for resources that have the
--   unified CloudWatch agent installed on them. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling Memory Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProjectedMetric</a> smart constructor.
data ProjectedMetric
ProjectedMetric' :: Maybe [Double] -> Maybe MetricName -> Maybe [POSIX] -> ProjectedMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>ProjectedMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:ProjectedMetric'</a>, <a>projectedMetric_values</a> -
--   The values of the projected utilization metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ProjectedMetric'</a>, <a>projectedMetric_name</a> - The
--   name of the projected utilization metric.
--   
--   The following projected utilization metrics are returned:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Cpu</tt> - The projected percentage of allocated EC2 compute
--   units that would be in use on the recommendation option had you used
--   that resource during the analyzed period. This metric identifies the
--   processing power required to run an application on the recommendation
--   option.Depending on the instance type, tools in your operating system
--   can show a lower percentage than CloudWatch when the instance is not
--   allocated a full processor core.Units: Percent</li>
--   <li><tt>Memory</tt> - The percentage of memory that would be in use on
--   the recommendation option had you used that resource during the
--   analyzed period. This metric identifies the amount of memory required
--   to run an application on the recommendation option.Units: PercentThe
--   <tt>Memory</tt> metric is returned only for resources that have the
--   unified CloudWatch agent installed on them. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling Memory Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamps:ProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>projectedMetric_timestamps</a> - The timestamps of the projected
--   utilization metric.
newProjectedMetric :: ProjectedMetric

-- | A summary of a finding reason code.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReasonCodeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ReasonCodeSummary
ReasonCodeSummary' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe FindingReasonCode -> ReasonCodeSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>ReasonCodeSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ReasonCodeSummary'</a>, <a>reasonCodeSummary_value</a> -
--   The value of the finding reason code summary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ReasonCodeSummary'</a>, <a>reasonCodeSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the finding reason code.
newReasonCodeSummary :: ReasonCodeSummary

-- | Describes a recommendation export job.
--   
--   Use the DescribeRecommendationExportJobs action to view your
--   recommendation export jobs.
--   
--   Use the ExportAutoScalingGroupRecommendations or
--   ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations actions to request an export of your
--   recommendations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationExportJob</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationExportJob

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   export job failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:RecommendationExportJob'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationExportJob_destination</a> - An object that describes
--   the destination of the export file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecommendationExportJob'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationExportJob_status</a> - The status of the export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:RecommendationExportJob'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationExportJob_jobId</a> - The identification number of
--   the export job.

newRecommendationExportJob :: RecommendationExportJob

-- | Describes preferences for recommendations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationPreferences</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationPreferences
RecommendationPreferences' :: Maybe [CpuVendorArchitecture] -> RecommendationPreferences

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationPreferences</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuVendorArchitectures:RecommendationPreferences'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationPreferences_cpuVendorArchitectures</a> - Specifies
--   the CPU vendor and architecture for Amazon EC2 instance and Auto
--   Scaling group recommendations.
--   
--   For example, when you specify <tt>AWS_ARM64</tt> with:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>A GetEC2InstanceRecommendations or
--   GetAutoScalingGroupRecommendations request, Compute Optimizer returns
--   recommendations that consist of Graviton2 instance types only.</li>
--   <li>A GetEC2RecommendationProjectedMetrics request, Compute Optimizer
--   returns projected utilization metrics for Graviton2 instance type
--   recommendations only.</li>
--   <li>A ExportEC2InstanceRecommendations or
--   ExportAutoScalingGroupRecommendations request, Compute Optimizer
--   exports recommendations that consist of Graviton2 instance types
--   only.</li>
--   </ul>
newRecommendationPreferences :: RecommendationPreferences

-- | Describes the source of a recommendation, such as an Amazon EC2
--   instance or Auto Scaling group.

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the recommendation source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationSourceType:RecommendationSource'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationSource_recommendationSourceType</a> - The resource
--   type of the recommendation source.
newRecommendationSource :: RecommendationSource

-- | A summary of a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationSummary
RecommendationSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Summary] -> Maybe RecommendationSourceType -> RecommendationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>recommendationSummary_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID of the recommendation summary.
