--   <a>$sel:summaries:RecommendationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationSummary_summaries</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe a recommendation summary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationResourceType:RecommendationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationSummary_recommendationResourceType</a> - The resource
--   type of the recommendation.
newRecommendationSummary :: RecommendationSummary

-- | Describes a projected utilization metric of a recommendation option.
--   
--   The <tt>Cpu</tt> and <tt>Memory</tt> metrics are the only projected
--   utilization metrics returned when you run the
--   GetEC2RecommendationProjectedMetrics action. Additionally, the
--   <tt>Memory</tt> metric is returned only for resources that have the
--   unified CloudWatch agent installed on them. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling Memory Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendedOptionProjectedMetric</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric
RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [ProjectedMetric] -> Maybe Int -> RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendedInstanceType:RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>recommendedOptionProjectedMetric_recommendedInstanceType</a> - The
--   recommended instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedMetrics:RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>recommendedOptionProjectedMetric_projectedMetrics</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe a projected utilization metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rank:RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric'</a>,
--   <a>recommendedOptionProjectedMetric_rank</a> - The rank of the
--   recommendation option projected metric.
--   
--   The top recommendation option is ranked as <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   The projected metric rank correlates to the recommendation option
--   rank. For example, the projected metric ranked as <tt>1</tt> is
--   related to the recommendation option that is also ranked as <tt>1</tt>
--   in the same response.
newRecommendedOptionProjectedMetric :: RecommendedOptionProjectedMetric

-- | Describes the destination Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket name and object keys of a recommendations export file, and its
--   associated metadata file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Destination</a> smart constructor.
data S3Destination
S3Destination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> S3Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Destination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_bucket</a> - The
--   name of the Amazon S3 bucket used as the destination of an export
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:S3Destination'</a>, <a>s3Destination_key</a> - The Amazon
--   S3 bucket key of an export file.
--   
--   The key uniquely identifies the object, or export file, in the S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadataKey:S3Destination'</a>,
--   <a>s3Destination_metadataKey</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket key of a
--   metadata file.
--   
--   The key uniquely identifies the object, or metadata file, in the S3
--   bucket.
newS3Destination :: S3Destination

-- | Describes the destination Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)
--   bucket name and key prefix for a recommendations export job.
--   
--   You must create the destination Amazon S3 bucket for your
--   recommendations export before you create the export job. Compute
--   Optimizer does not create the S3 bucket for you. After you create the
--   S3 bucket, ensure that it has the required permission policy to allow
--   Compute Optimizer to write the export file to it. If you plan to
--   specify an object prefix when you create the export job, you must
--   include the object prefix in the policy that you add to the S3 bucket.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Policy for Compute
--   Optimizer</a> in the <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3DestinationConfig</a> smart constructor.
data S3DestinationConfig
S3DestinationConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> S3DestinationConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>S3DestinationConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:S3DestinationConfig'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfig_bucket</a> - The name of the Amazon S3 bucket
--   to use as the destination for an export job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPrefix:S3DestinationConfig'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfig_keyPrefix</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket prefix for
--   an export job.
newS3DestinationConfig :: S3DestinationConfig

-- | The summary of a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSummary</a> smart constructor.
data Summary
Summary' :: Maybe [ReasonCodeSummary] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Finding -> Summary

-- | Create a value of <a>Summary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCodeSummaries:Summary'</a>,
--   <a>summary_reasonCodeSummaries</a> - An array of objects that
--   summarize a finding reason code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Summary'</a>, <a>summary_value</a> - The value of the
--   recommendation summary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Summary'</a>, <a>summary_name</a> - The finding
--   classification of the recommendation.
newSummary :: Summary

-- | Describes a utilization metric of a resource, such as an Amazon EC2
--   instance.
--   
--   Compare the utilization metric data of your resource against its
--   projected utilization metric data to determine the performance
--   difference between your current resource and the recommended option.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUtilizationMetric</a> smart constructor.
data UtilizationMetric
UtilizationMetric' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe MetricName -> Maybe MetricStatistic -> UtilizationMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>UtilizationMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:UtilizationMetric'</a>, <a>utilizationMetric_value</a> -
--   The value of the utilization metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UtilizationMetric'</a>, <a>utilizationMetric_name</a> -
--   The name of the utilization metric.
--   
--   The following utilization metrics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Cpu</tt> - The percentage of allocated EC2 compute units that
--   are currently in use on the instance. This metric identifies the
--   processing power required to run an application on the
--   instance.Depending on the instance type, tools in your operating
--   system can show a lower percentage than CloudWatch when the instance
--   is not allocated a full processor core.Units: Percent</li>
--   <li><tt>Memory</tt> - The percentage of memory that is currently in
--   use on the instance. This metric identifies the amount of memory
--   required to run an application on the instance.Units: PercentThe
--   <tt>Memory</tt> metric is returned only for resources that have the
--   unified CloudWatch agent installed on them. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling Memory Utilization with the CloudWatch Agent</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS_READ_OPS_PER_SECOND</tt> - The completed read operations
--   from all EBS volumes attached to the instance in a specified period of
--   time.Unit: Count</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS_WRITE_OPS_PER_SECOND</tt> - The completed write operations
--   to all EBS volumes attached to the instance in a specified period of
--   time.Unit: Count</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS_READ_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The bytes read from all EBS
--   volumes attached to the instance in a specified period of time.Unit:
--   Bytes</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS_WRITE_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The bytes written to all EBS
--   volumes attached to the instance in a specified period of time.Unit:
--   Bytes</li>
--   <li><tt>DISK_READ_OPS_PER_SECOND</tt> - The completed read operations
--   from all instance store volumes available to the instance in a
--   specified period of time.If there are no instance store volumes,
--   either the value is <tt>0</tt> or the metric is not reported.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISK_WRITE_OPS_PER_SECOND</tt> - The completed write
--   operations from all instance store volumes available to the instance
--   in a specified period of time.If there are no instance store volumes,
--   either the value is <tt>0</tt> or the metric is not reported.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISK_READ_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The bytes read from all
--   instance store volumes available to the instance. This metric is used
--   to determine the volume of the data the application reads from the
--   disk of the instance. This can be used to determine the speed of the
--   application.If there are no instance store volumes, either the value
--   is <tt>0</tt> or the metric is not reported.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISK_WRITE_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The bytes written to all
--   instance store volumes available to the instance. This metric is used
--   to determine the volume of the data the application writes onto the
--   disk of the instance. This can be used to determine the speed of the
--   application.If there are no instance store volumes, either the value
--   is <tt>0</tt> or the metric is not reported.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_IN_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The number of bytes
--   received by the instance on all network interfaces. This metric
--   identifies the volume of incoming network traffic to a single
--   instance.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_OUT_BYTES_PER_SECOND</tt> - The number of bytes sent
--   out by the instance on all network interfaces. This metric identifies
--   the volume of outgoing network traffic from a single instance.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_PACKETS_IN_PER_SECOND</tt> - The number of packets
--   received by the instance on all network interfaces. This metric
--   identifies the volume of incoming traffic in terms of the number of
--   packets on a single instance.</li>
--   <li><tt>NETWORK_PACKETS_OUT_PER_SECOND</tt> - The number of packets
--   sent out by the instance on all network interfaces. This metric
--   identifies the volume of outgoing traffic in terms of the number of
--   packets on a single instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:UtilizationMetric'</a>,
--   <a>utilizationMetric_statistic</a> - The statistic of the utilization
--   metric.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer API, Command Line Interface (CLI), and SDKs
--   return utilization metrics using only the <tt>Maximum</tt> statistic,
--   which is the highest value observed during the specified period.
--   
--   The Compute Optimizer console displays graphs for some utilization
--   metrics using the <tt>Average</tt> statistic, which is the value of
--   <tt>Sum</tt> / <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. For
--   more information, see <a>Viewing resource recommendations</a> in the
--   <i>Compute Optimizer User Guide</i>. You can also get averaged
--   utilization metric data for your resources using Amazon CloudWatch.
--   For more information, see the <a>Amazon CloudWatch User Guide</a>.
newUtilizationMetric :: UtilizationMetric

-- | Describes the configuration of an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon
--   EBS) volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeConfiguration
VolumeConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSize:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeSize</a> - The size of the volume, in
--   GiB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeBaselineIOPS:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeBaselineIOPS</a> - The baseline IOPS of
--   the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeBurstIOPS:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeBurstIOPS</a> - The burst IOPS of the
--   volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeType</a> - The volume type.
--   
--   This can be <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose SSD, <tt>io1</tt> or
--   <tt>io2</tt> for Provisioned IOPS SSD, <tt>st1</tt> for Throughput
--   Optimized HDD, <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold HDD, or <tt>standard</tt> for
--   Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeBurstThroughput:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeBurstThroughput</a> - The burst
--   throughput of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeBaselineThroughput:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeBaselineThroughput</a> - The baseline
--   throughput of the volume.
newVolumeConfiguration :: VolumeConfiguration

-- | Describes an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeRecommendation
VolumeRecommendation' :: Maybe EBSFinding -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [EBSUtilizationMetric] -> Maybe [VolumeRecommendationOption] -> Maybe Double -> VolumeRecommendation

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeRecommendation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:finding:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_finding</a> - The finding classification of
--   the volume.
--   
--   Findings for volumes include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NotOptimized</tt></b> —A volume is considered not optimized
--   when Compute Optimizer identifies a recommendation that can provide
--   better performance for your workload.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Optimized</tt></b> —An volume is considered optimized when
--   Compute Optimizer determines that the volume is correctly provisioned
--   to run your workload based on the chosen volume type. For optimized
--   resources, Compute Optimizer might recommend a new generation volume
--   type.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeArn:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_volumeArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the current volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRefreshTimestamp:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_lastRefreshTimestamp</a> - The timestamp of
--   when the volume recommendation was last refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentConfiguration:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_currentConfiguration</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the current configuration of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_accountId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account ID of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilizationMetrics:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_utilizationMetrics</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the utilization metrics of the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeRecommendationOptions:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_volumeRecommendationOptions</a> - An array of
--   objects that describe the recommendation options for the volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookBackPeriodInDays:VolumeRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendation_lookBackPeriodInDays</a> - The number of days
--   for which utilization metrics were analyzed for the volume.
newVolumeRecommendation :: VolumeRecommendation

-- | Describes a recommendation option for an Amazon Elastic Block Store
--   (Amazon EBS) instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeRecommendationOption</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeRecommendationOption
VolumeRecommendationOption' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Int -> VolumeRecommendationOption

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeRecommendationOption</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:performanceRisk:VolumeRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendationOption_performanceRisk</a> - The performance
--   risk of the volume recommendation option.
--   
--   Performance risk is the likelihood of the recommended volume type
--   meeting the performance requirement of your workload.
--   
--   The value ranges from <tt>0</tt> - <tt>4</tt>, with <tt>0</tt> meaning
--   that the recommended resource is predicted to always provide enough
--   hardware capability. The higher the performance risk is, the more
--   likely you should validate whether the recommendation will meet the
--   performance requirements of your workload before migrating your
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:VolumeRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendationOption_configuration</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe a volume configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rank:VolumeRecommendationOption'</a>,
--   <a>volumeRecommendationOption_rank</a> - The rank of the volume
--   recommendation option.
--   
--   The top recommendation option is ranked as <tt>1</tt>.
newVolumeRecommendationOption :: VolumeRecommendationOption
